com.xtructure.xsim.impl
Class AbstractSimpleStandardXComponent

java.lang.Object
  com.xtructure.xutil.id.AbstractXIdObject
      com.xtructure.xsim.impl.AbstractStandardXComponent
          com.xtructure.xsim.impl.AbstractSimpleStandardXComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
XComponent<StandardXClock.StandardTimePhase>, XIdObject, java.lang.Comparable<XIdObject>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractSimpleStandardXVisualization, ComponentGrid
public abstract class AbstractSimpleStandardXComponent
extends AbstractStandardXComponent

A base class for components that use a StandardXClock and process only one update per target.

Version:
0.9.6
Author:
Peter Nürnberg

prepareBeforeHook

protected void prepareBeforeHook()
A pre-processing hook for AbstractStandardXComponent.prepare().

This method clears the data map. If a specialization of this type overrides this method, it should take care to call the overriden version.

Overrides:
prepareBeforeHook in class AbstractStandardXComponent

update

protected void update()
A processing hook for AbstractStandardXComponent.update(XTime) in the StandardXClock.StandardTimePhase.UPDATE phase.

This method calls setData(XId, Object) on every target for which data was received, and optinally calls blankTarget(XId) for every target for which no data was received.

Overrides:
update in class AbstractStandardXComponent

protected final void informNonBlankTargets()
Informs non-blank targets of data.

protected final void informBlankTargets()

blankTarget

protected void blankTarget(XId targetId)
Reflects that the identified target received no data during the last update cycle.

Parameters:
targetId - the id of the blank target

processForeignData

protected java.lang.Object processForeignData(XId targetId,
                                              java.lang.Object newData)
Processes the given calculate data.

By default, this method throws an IllegalStateException if there has already been calculate data associated with the given target data. Otherwise, the given data is returned as is.

Parameters:
targetId - the id of the target for which the given data is intended
newData - the data for the identified target
Returns:
a processed form of the given data

setData

protected abstract void setData(XId partId,
                                java.lang.Object data)
Sets the data associated with the identified part.

Parameters:
partId - the id of the part, the data of which should be set
data - the data to be set
